skill.name: frontend-orchestrator
skill.description: Coordinates frontend development tasks (React, TypeScript, UI/UX). Use when implementing user interfaces, components, state management, or visual features. Applies frontend-standard.md for quality gates.
skill.summary: Coordinates frontend development tasks (React, TypeScript, UI/UX). Use when implementing user interf...
skill.author: Brownbull

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based orchestrator skill containing only documentation and guidelines. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution capabilities detected.

content.value_statement: Managing frontend development across React, TypeScript, and UI/UX projects requires coordination between multiple skills and quality standards. This orchestrator assigns tasks, validates component architecture, and ensures accessibility compliance.
actual_capabilities: Coordinates React component development and updates
limitations: Does not write code directly - coordinates other skills
Requires ai-state directory for context persistence
Cannot execute without other frontend skills present

use_cases.title: Component Architecture
use_cases.description: Create and manage React components with TypeScript, design system integration, and accessibility validation.

use_cases.title: State Management
use_cases.description: Implement Redux stores or Context providers with proper action serialization and computed selectors.

use_cases.title: Visual Testing
use_cases.description: Run Playwright visual tests across viewport sizes, validate loading states, and check responsiveness.

prompt_templates.title: Create Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a React component at [location] with [purpose]. Apply TypeScript types, error boundaries, loading states, and memoization where needed.

prompt_templates.title: Update State
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the [Redux/Context] store to handle [new feature]. Ensure actions are serializable and computed values use selectors.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Accessibility
prompt_templates.prompt: Run accessibility audit on [component/page]. Check keyboard navigation, screen reader compatibility, and color contrast.

prompt_templates.title: Visual Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Playwright visual tests on [component]. Validate rendering at mobile, tablet, and desktop viewport sizes with loading states.

output_examples.input: Create a login form component with email and password fields
output: TypeScript interfaces defined for props and state
Error boundary implemented with fallback UI
Loading state handling for async validation
Design system components: Button, Input, Card applied
Keyboard navigation and focus management verified
Unit tests written with React Testing Library
Visual tests passed across all viewport sizes

best_practices: Use single source of truth for state and keep components focused on presentation
Validate accessibility (WCAG AA) for every new component before merging
Write visual tests with Playwright for responsive behavior across devices
anti_patterns: Avoid placing business logic directly in React components
Do not skip error boundaries or loading state handling
Never use inline styles instead of design system or Tailwind classes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Compatible with any Claude-family model supporting skill orchestration.

faq.question: What React patterns does it enforce?
faq.answer: TypeScript strict mode, error boundaries, memoization, and single source of truth for state management.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Passes context packages to skills like react-component-skill, state-management-skill, and ui-test-skill.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only reads its own documentation files. It coordinates other skills but does not access or store user data.

faq.question: What tests must pass before deployment?
faq.answer: Unit tests, visual tests (Playwright), accessibility tests (WCAG AA), and responsive tests across mobile/tablet/desktop.

faq.question: How is this different from a coding assistant?
faq.answer: Orchestrator skills coordinate multiple specialized skills rather than writing code directly. Ensures quality gates and consistency.
